common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers macOS UI and Functionality Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various UI and functionality bugs with Pieces for Developers on macOS, including mysterious icons appearing in Obsidian, "Context exceeded" errors during onboarding, and demo chats failing to load. Troubleshooting steps varied, and some issues are still under investigation by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: [Obsidian]
related_issues.text:
[Obsidian]
### Software

Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When resizing the right tray, two mysterious icons appear in upper left and lower right

Occurs in both Copilot and Snippets tabs

Confirmed this only happens when Pieces is active in the right tray, not when other plugins are active in the right tray.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/830457d3-4dfc-44fa-a0dc-3f50ab7ea906


Obsidian version 
1.7.7

System
```
Model Name: MacBook Pro
Model Identifier: MacBookPro18,2
Chip: Apple M1 Max
Total Number of Cores: 10 (8 performance and 2 efficiency)
Memory: 64 GB
System Firmware Version: 10151.101.3
OS Loader Version: 10151.101.3
```






## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on Copilot Icon

**Key Points Raised:**

* Claire reported an issue where they couldn't see the video they posted.
* Mason clarified that the two icons appearing in the corner of Copilot are expected behavior and not an error.

**Identified Problems:**

* User wasn't able to see the video they posted.
* User was concerned about the two icons appearing in the corner of Copilot.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Mason explained that the icons are expected behavior and serve as identifiers for Copilot's location on the screen.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Claire acknowledged and accepted Mason's explanation, resolving the issue.

related_issues.title: PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
related_issues.text:
PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

On first use of PFD v. 3.2.4 after completing the install wizard, I get a "Context exceeded" error with a short message to copilot in empty chat using (using default model `Claude Sonnet 3.5`) 

Repro 
1. fresh install of PDF on MacOS
2. complete wizard with defaults
3. in chat opened on load, ask default model Claude Sonnet 3.5 "Yo world"

May be related to #487 , but creating separate issue as it relates to onboarding

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/481c3e22-5e84-436d-b81a-4f8bfdc88083

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**### Key Points Raised:**

* User `claire-at-pieces` created an issue related to Copilot.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate team.
* The user was provided with links to related issues and helpful resources.
* The issue was marked as a duplicate of another issue: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/487

**### Problem Identified:**

There appears to be an issue with Copilot. The user has experienced a problem, and the issue has been identified as a duplicate of another known issue.

**### Solution Proposed/Implemented:**

The issue is expected to be resolved in the next release of PiecesOS.

**### Current Status/Outcome:**

The issue will be fixed in the next release of PiecesOS. The user is advised to wait for the update.

related_issues.title: Demo Chat are stuck loading
related_issues.text:
Demo Chat are stuck loading
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I set up a demo instance of pieces in a VM to test a bug report, for that purpose I skipped the onboarding completely, since then the demo chats are loading:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4c5b430-b6ad-4a90-a256-b410fcae09e5)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041156/log-12062024.txt)
PfD: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041159/log-12062024.txt)

pieces are loaded and annotated correctly:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbba8dfd-5872-4ee4-a9e3-31a9a55f0518)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @hra42 reported empty chats after restarting pOS and PfD.
* Images showcasing the empty chats and expected functionality were provided.
* Developer @mack-at-pieces identified the issue as likely related to a failure in creating demo conversations.
* User @hra42 offered information on their VM setup for testing purposes.

**Problems Identified:**

* pOS and PfD restarts resulted in empty chats.
* Demo conversations were not being created properly.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces planned to investigate the issue further by replicating the VM setup.
* Additional information on user setup was requested to help troubleshoot the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ended with @mack-at-pieces planning to investigate further.
* No solution was implemented at the time of this summary.

## Additional Notes:

* The conversation was initiated on December 6, 2024, and the last update was on December 9, 2024.
* Additional details about the issue were not provided in the conversation summary.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Extension Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS getting stuck, failing to launch, or VS Extension not connecting.  This seems to affect Windows primarily.  Suggested solutions include checking for updates, restarting Pieces, and ensuring Pieces OS is running.  Root causes are still being investigated, potentially related to port selection, OS errors, or firewall/permission issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## GitHub Issue Summary: "OS toolbar not launching correctly"

**Key points raised:**

* The OS toolbar is not launching correctly in various ways (Visual Studio, desktop app, etc.).
* The Visual Studio plugin is potentially causing a UI thread hang.
* After updating VS plugin and Pieces OS, the issue persists.
* Pieces OS is restarting on its own sometimes.

**Problems identified:**

* An issue with version 3.0.0 of the Visual Studio plugin.
* A potential issue with how ports are chosen for webviews in the Pieces OS tool window.
* An OS error is preventing applets from being hosted.
* The Dart language sdk doesn't return the actual OS error code.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Hotfix Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 to resolve the UI thread hang.
* Release Pieces OS version 10.1.15 with a change to port selection for webviews.
* Request a screen recording of the issue from the user.
* Schedule a time to further debug and narrow down the root cause.
* Use a utility to retrieve the OS error code.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The proposed solutions haven't resolved the issue for the user.
* The root cause is still being investigated, with lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, and permission issues being possible suspects.
* A follow-up debugging session has been scheduled.

related_issues.title: Something went wrong with processing
related_issues.text:
Something went wrong with processing
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.15

### Early Access Program

Any answer gives an error. This problem is the second day.

## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Key Points:**

* User @AndreyPLtn reported an issue with unhandled exceptions and processing errors in Pieces OS and Visual Studio Extension.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* User was directed to similar issues and resources for help.

**Problems Identified:**

* Unhandled exceptions and processing errors in Pieces OS and Visual Studio Extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User directed to similar issues and resources for help.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue flagged as a duplicate of another issue #471. User advised to refer to #471 for further updates and solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User `omkar-4` opened an issue about Pieces app crashing when using files/folders as context.
* The issue has been automatically routed to the Pieces team.
* The bot suggests checking similar issues and provided resources.
* Pieces team member `mark-at-pieces` asks for details about the files/folders used to reproduce the crash.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces app crashes when using files/folders as context.
* The issue is difficult to reproduce and troubleshoot.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User is requested to share the files/folders used with Pieces Copilot to help reproduce the issue.
* If user provides files/folders, the Pieces team will be able to troubleshoot the crash.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Waiting for user to respond with requested files/folders.
* Issue is pending further information.

This summary focuses on the key points of the conversation while keeping it concise. It highlights the important details and current status to provide a clear understanding of the issue and its progress.

common_issues.title: Pieces Onboarding Issues on macOS
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with the Pieces onboarding process on macOS, including inaccessible UI elements on smaller screens, failure to generate demo data, and errors with Copilot. Proposed solutions involve UI improvements, bug fixes, and ensuring compatibility with different screen sizes and macOS versions.

related_issues.title: Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* The user encountered an interface bug where the "Next" button was positioned off-screen on a smaller laptop screen.
* The user was able to navigate around the bug by tabbing.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces onboarding process did not consider smaller screen sizes, causing UI elements to be inaccessible.
* The layout of the onboarding process was fixed, preventing resizing.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The developer confirmed this is a duplicate of a known issue (#470).
* The next release of Pieces will allow resizing the window during onboarding.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is acknowledged and a fix is planned for the next release.
* The user is advised to share their system display size and resolution for further analysis.

**Additional Note:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of considering diverse screen sizes and device capabilities during development.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points:**

* A user reported an issue with Pieces demo chat getting stuck loading.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* The user was advised to check similar issues and resources while waiting for a response.
* After 24 hours, the issue was investigated further.
* It was discovered that the user ran into a PERMISSION_DENIED error with Pieces' cloud services.

**Identified problem:**

* Onboarding snippets and conversations were skipped due to a bug.
* The user encountered a permission error when using Pieces' cloud services.

**Proposed/implemented solution:**

* The Pieces team investigated the bug and permission error.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The outcome of the investigation is unclear from the conversation.
* The issue remains open, suggesting the problem might not be fully resolved.

common_issues.title: Claude LLM Context Exceeded Error
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing "Context exceeded" errors when using the Claude LLM, even with short messages. This issue appears across different operating systems (Linux, macOS, Windows). The problem is likely a duplicate of a known issue and is expected to be resolved in a future Pieces OS update. Users encountering this error are advised to check for updates or refer to related support tickets for potential workarounds.

related_issues.title: Message exceeded the context limit for claude LLM Issue
related_issues.text:
Message exceeded the context limit for claude LLM Issue
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.15

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/262696c2-c641-4337-9966-abdc4fb18739)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Duplicate Issue

**Key Points:**

* Duplicate issue of https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/487.
* Problem identified: The issue is a duplicate.
* Proposed solution: Close the duplicate issue.

**Outcome:**

* The issue is closed as a duplicate. 
* The problem is expected to be resolved in the next release.

**Additional Details:**

* The issue was triaged and routed to the appropriate team member.
* Related issues and resources were provided for reference.
* Mark-at-pieces closed the issue as a duplicate.

**Note:** The conversation mentions a potential release for late this week or early next week, but this information is outdated as of November 2023.

related_issues.title: I'am sorry Something went wrong with processing. please wait a few seconds and try again or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I'am sorry Something went wrong with processing. please wait a few seconds and try again or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

the ChatGpt does not work but with other Gemini works I had faced this before also after trying different solutions  I formatted my laptop by installing new windows, and it worked for 4 days after that, with the same issue please fix this issue. end semester exams are near we need ChatGPT

yes Gemini works but it sucks ChatGPT is best 

 **please fix this issue**

Thank You 
### pieces information
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e95be432-efd0-42e6-b789-2aac6b6dab35)

### The Bug/ issue
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/49aa784e-24b1-46dc-b182-a7d3484ba42b)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* The issue reported by @Kiran-Jadhav200 is categorized as a "Something went wrong with processing" error in the Pieces App.
* The author mentions encountering this error when using the GPT feature.
* The issue is flagged as a possible duplicate of issue #471.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user encounters an error message "Something went wrong with processing" when using the GPT feature in the Pieces App.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* The user is asked to paste a specific request in their browser while PiecesOS is running.
* The result is then sent to a developer for further diagnosis.
* The issue is closed as a duplicate of issue #471.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is closed as a duplicate.
* The user is advised to refer to the developer's feedback for further guidance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests that the problem may be related to an existing issue with GPT processing.
* The user is directed to relevant resources for further information and support.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS: "Something went wrong processing"
common_issues.description: Users report encountering "Something went wrong processing" errors specifically when using the ChatGPT feature within the Pieces OS desktop application on various operating systems. The issue appears to be related to message processing or API calls. Proposed solutions involve checking for duplicate issues, providing detailed logs, and waiting for a software update.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* The issue reported by @Kiran-Jadhav200 is categorized as a "Something went wrong with processing" error in the Pieces App.
* The author mentions encountering this error when using the GPT feature.
* The issue is flagged as a possible duplicate of issue #471.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user encounters an error message "Something went wrong with processing" when using the GPT feature in the Pieces App.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* The user is asked to paste a specific request in their browser while PiecesOS is running.
* The result is then sent to a developer for further diagnosis.
* The issue is closed as a duplicate of issue #471.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is closed as a duplicate.
* The user is advised to refer to the developer's feedback for further guidance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests that the problem may be related to an existing issue with GPT processing.
* The user is directed to relevant resources for further information and support.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS and VS Extension connectivity issues:** This recurring problem causes significant user frustration and impacts core functionality. Investigate root causes like port selection, OS errors, and firewall/permissions.

**Address Pieces Onboarding Issues on macOS:** Onboarding is a user's first experience. Ensure a smooth process by resolving UI issues on smaller screens, demo data generation failures, and Copilot errors.
**Investigate and fix "Context exceeded" errors with Claude LLM:** This error occurs even with short messages, impacting user workflow. Prioritize a fix to improve Claude LLM usability.

**Improve error messaging and troubleshooting for "Something went wrong processing" errors:**  Provide more specific error messages to help users and support teams identify the root cause.  This may involve improving logging within the application.

**Gather more detailed information about user environments for issues like onboarding failures and connectivity problems:** Requesting system specs, macOS versions, and error logs can help pinpoint platform-specific issues.
**Consider creating dedicated troubleshooting guides for common issues:** This can empower users to self-serve and potentially reduce ticket volume.
**Review and update documentation for onboarding, VS Extension setup, and Claude LLM usage:** Clear and up-to-date documentation can prevent user errors and confusion.
